titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Moses Green papers, 1814-1815
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, May 2019

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Morning reports and forage and provision returns of Captain A. Stevenson's company of artillery of 2nd Elite Corps of the Virginia militia commanded by Col. Moses Green, in the service of the U.S. Army; and regimental orders issued by Green. Reports and returns were issued from Camp Holly near New Market, Virginia and Camp Charles City Court House, Virginia.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Moses Green Papers, 1814-1815, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Morning reports and forage and provision returns of Captain A. Stevenson's company of artillery of 2nd Elite Corps of the Virginia militia commanded by Col. Moses Green, in the service of the U.S. Army; and regimental orders issued by Green. Reports and returns were issued from Camp Holly near New Market, Virginia and Camp Charles City Court House, Virginia.
